newsitem.title: USA: US wkly chain store sales up 1.3 pct - BTM/Schroders.
newsitem.headline: US wkly chain store sales up 1.3 pct - BTM/Schroders.

text.p: U.S. chain store sales rose 1.3 percent in the week ended August 31 from the prior week, according to the seasonally adjusted BTM/Schroders weekly chain store sales index.
Sales for the week were up 6.8 percent on a year-over-year basis.
The month-to-date index rose 0.7 percent from the prior month.
"On a year/year basis, the sales gain was inflated by some stores having a mismatched comparison between the Labor Day weekend this year versus the week before Labor Day last year," the report said.
"The back-to-school sales performance was decent during (August)," it said.
